lines.text: You call this roughing it?
One bathroom for nine people? Yes.
[the Red Feathers, including Velda's daughter Cleo, abandon an injured Velda in order to win]
CLEO! I was in labor with you for 17 hours! I bought you your first tricy... I have patches, girls! I can get you into West Point.
[the Red Feathers disappear into the distance]
YOU LITTLE BITCHES!
[Velda's scream is so loud that Troop Beverly Hills happens to hear it]
Oh, my god. What's that?
Don't worry, it's probably just one of nature's beasts.

[shouts]
Ingrates! I hate children! I hate them!

[Realizes who the voice is]
Yup! It's a beast, all right. Move out.
Oh, what glorious patches!
Thank you, ma'am.
Where can I buy them?
Ma'am, you don't buy them, you earn them.
Oh! Like jewelry!
You never give me credit for anything I do.
That's because you never do anything!
the Beverly Hills Hotel.
I may be a beginner at some things, but I've got a black belt in shopping!
You can't put wine in Hobo stew!
Why not? What goes better with Hobos than wine?
Why don't you guys just kiss and make up? That way, I won't end up in therapy twice a week, like Tessa!
Honey, you'll be much less neurotic if your parents are happily divorced, rather than unhappily married.
Thank you, Phil Donahue.
I saw it on Oprah!
[seeing Troop Beverly Hills on stage]

[to the troop]
Where are you from, Mars?
Worse. Beverly Hills.

[Stomping out Phyllis's cigarette ash]
Mrs. Nefler! We're above the fire line! And you shouldn't smoke, it's bad for you. And it conceals neurosis you should deal with yourself.
Smokey Bear says, "Only you can prevent forest fires."
Well, Smokey Bear isn't going through a horribly mess divorce!

[Examining Velda's leg wound]
There's multiple contusions, and possibly a cracked fibula, and a severe personality disorder.
Patches? We don't need no stinkin patches.

[to Annie Herman]
Are you related to Pee Wee?
Get your damn car out of my friendship ring.
Hi, Vel. Lovely to see you too.
Okay, fine! On your marks! Get Set! Go!
[Fires into the air, causing a crow to fall to the ground]
EWWWWWW!
What an adventure! Isn't nature fabulous, girls?
[the girls suddenly run ahead of her]
Oh, good spirits, Tiffany! Good spirits, girls! A few positive words for me and they get their second run.
[Looks behind and sees the skunk that is coming after them]
AH!
[Runs after the girls]
[Velda sees that a skunk was responsible for Troop Beverly Hills coming in first ahead of Red Feathers]

[Picks up skunk]
You're gonna pay for this! Yes, you are!
[the girls have made a make-shift stretcher using some of their backpacks to carry Velda]
I knew I could count on you girls to do the right thing.
Oh, stop, or I'll bust out crying. I knew I could count on you *losers* to do the wimpy thing.
You need your rest.
You had so much energy, you were so creative, I couldn't wait to see what you'd do with it. And see, now I know what you did with it. You Went Shopping!
Hey, I went shopping, Buster, to furnish your perfect house, to build your perfect image, to be your perfect Beverly Hills wife!
So much for being normal.
We're the girls from Beverly Hills, shopping is our greatest thrill!
The parents here are so self involved. Shit, I broke a nail!
If you contributed anymore to this marriage, we would be on welfare.
It's about time you two grew up.
That just frosts my cookies!
This dance is called "The Freddie." I know, I know. Life is so ironic.

[whispers and wave]
Hi Daddy.

[upon seeing her own father, she follows Hannah's example]
Hi Daddy.

[to Hannah]
Hi sweetie.

[to Claire]
Hi sweetie.
[Last Lines]
[Velda is working as a cashier at a Kmart store after being fired from the Wilderness Girls]
Attention Kmart shoppers, Blue Light special on aisle 13...
[pauses]
... Cookies!

It was a cold and rainy day in March. I went to Kristoff's where I usually get my hair done but Kristoff wasn't there. He had mysteriously disappeared. In his place was a stranger named Rinaldo. I'll never forget him. His eyes were steely gray. His hands were like ice. He said, "I'll streak your hair and I'll give you a body wave." He worked very fast and then, as he turned my chair around to face the mirror, I saw it. He permed me!

[after seeing that Troop Beverly Hills have managed to make it to the other side of the ravine despite the sabotaged bridge]
Damn! Those little Dim-besses are *really* starting to bug me.
